items.label: Introduction
items.title: Introduction to DrawUI
items.description: A React component library with hand-drawn, sketchy appearance powered by Rough.js

content.value: DrawUI is a React component library that brings a unique, hand-drawn aesthetic to your applications. Built on top of Rough.js, it provides a collection of UI components with a sketchy, organic appearance that stands out from traditional design systems.

DrawUI offers a playful and creative alternative to conventional UI libraries. Perfect for portfolios, creative projects, educational tools, or any application where you want to add personality and warmth to the user interface.

- Hand-drawn sketchy appearance powered by Rough.js
- Comprehensive theming system with customizable tokens
- Consistent design language across all components
- Built with TypeScript for excellent type safety
- Lightweight and performant
- Easy to integrate with existing React projects

items.label: Design Tokens
items.title: Design Tokens Reference
items.description: Complete reference of all design tokens

content.value: Stroke tokens define the border weight and color of components. Available weights: thin, medium, thick.
Roughness controls the sketchy appearance intensity. Higher values create more irregular, hand-drawn effects.
Radius tokens define corner roundness. Available values: none, sm, md, lg, full.
Size tokens are component-specific and define dimensions. Available sizes: sm, md, lg, xl.
Fill styles from Rough.js define how shapes are filled. Available styles: hachure, solid, zigzag, cross-hatch, dots, sunburst, dashed, zigzag-line.

items.label: DrawuiInput
items.title: DrawuiInput Component
items.description: A sketchy input field component with customizable stroke, radius, fill, and size, powered by Rough.js

content.value: The `DrawuiInput` component provides a hand-drawn styled input field that can be customized with different stroke weights, background colors, radii, and input sizes. It leverages Rough.js to render a sketchy, organic border around the input, giving it a playful, handmade appearance.

- `strokeWeight`: Adjusts the thickness of the sketchy border. Options: `thin`, `medium`, `thick`. Default is `medium`.
- `backgroundColor`: Sets the fill color of the input area.
- `radius`: Sets the corner radius. Options: `none`, `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `full`. Default is `md`.
- `inputSize`: Controls the height, font size, and padding. Options: `sm`, `md`, `lg`. Default is `md`.
- `fillStyle`: Determines the Rough.js fill style. Options: `hachure`, `solid`, `zigzag`, `dots`, etc.

<DrawuiInput 
  placeholder="Search..." 
  strokeWeight="thick" 
  backgroundColor="#fefefe" 
  radius="lg" 
  inputSize="lg" 
  fillStyle="solid" 
/>

The component reacts to `focus` and `hover` states:
- When focused, the sketchiness increases slightly to indicate active state.
- Hovering over the input slightly changes the sketch lines for a subtle interactive feedback.

All other standard input events (`onChange`, `onFocus`, `onBlur`) are fully supported.

- The input is fully accessible and supports keyboard navigation.
- Styling can be combined with Tailwind or custom CSS modules.
- The Rough.js SVG is positioned absolutely behind the input, with `pointer-events: none` to ensure the input remains interactive.
The DrawuiCollapse component provides an expandable/collapsible panel with a sketchy appearance.

items.label: Rough.js Integration
items.title: Understanding Rough.js Integration
items.description: How DrawUI leverages Rough.js for sketchy rendering

content.value: DrawUI is built on top of Rough.js, a lightweight graphics library that creates graphics with a hand-drawn, sketchy appearance. All DrawUI components use Rough.js under the hood to render SVG elements.
Each component uses React refs to access SVG elements and Rough.js to draw shapes. The rendering happens in useEffect hooks, ensuring the sketchy appearance updates when props or theme values change.

DrawUI exposes several Rough.js properties through component props:

- roughness: Controls the irregularity of lines (controlled via theme)
- bowing: Controls how much lines curve (controlled via theme)
- fillStyle: Defines how shapes are filled (hachure, solid, zigzag, etc.)
- stroke: Border color and width
- fill: Background color
